trans-unit.source: Use Management Portal to Create Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream
trans-unit.target: Use Management Portal to Create Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through the steps of creating a Channel that receives a single-bitrate live stream and encodes it to multi-bitrate stream.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through the steps of creating a Channel that receives a single-bitrate live stream and encodes it to multi-bitrate stream.

trans-unit.source: Use Management Portal to Create Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream (Preview)
trans-unit.target: Use Management Portal to Create Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream (Preview)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Portal
trans-unit.target: Portal

trans-unit.source: .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through the steps of creating a **Channel** that receives a single-bitrate live stream and encodes it to multi-bitrate stream.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through the steps of creating a **Channel** that receives a single-bitrate live stream and encodes it to multi-bitrate stream.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]For more conceptual information related to Channels that are enabled for live encoding, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]For more conceptual information related to Channels that are enabled for live encoding, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).

trans-unit.source: Common Live Streaming Scenario
trans-unit.target: Common Live Streaming Scenario

trans-unit.source: The following are general steps involved in creating common live streaming applications.
trans-unit.target: The following are general steps involved in creating common live streaming applications.

trans-unit.source: Connect a video camera to a computer.
trans-unit.target: Connect a video camera to a computer.

trans-unit.source: Launch and configure an on-premises live encoder that can output a single bitrate stream in one of the following protocols: RTMP, Smooth Streaming, or RTP (MPEG-TS).
trans-unit.target: Launch and configure an on-premises live encoder that can output a single bitrate stream in one of the following protocols: RTMP, Smooth Streaming, or RTP (MPEG-TS).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Media Services RTMP Support and Live Encoders](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=532824).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Media Services RTMP Support and Live Encoders](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=532824).

trans-unit.source: This step could also be performed after you create your Channel.
trans-unit.target: This step could also be performed after you create your Channel.

trans-unit.source: Create and start a Channel.
trans-unit.target: Create and start a Channel.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the Channel ingest URL.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the Channel ingest URL.

trans-unit.source: The ingest URL is used by the live encoder to send the stream to the Channel.
trans-unit.target: The ingest URL is used by the live encoder to send the stream to the Channel.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the Channel preview URL.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the Channel preview URL.

trans-unit.source: Use this URL to verify that your channel is properly receiving the live stream.
trans-unit.target: Use this URL to verify that your channel is properly receiving the live stream.

trans-unit.source: Create a program (that will also create an asset).
trans-unit.target: Create a program (that will also create an asset).

trans-unit.source: Publish the program (that will create an OnDemand locator for the associated asset).
trans-unit.target: Publish the program (that will create an OnDemand locator for the associated asset).

trans-unit.source: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.

trans-unit.source: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.
trans-unit.target: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, the live encoder can be signaled to start an advertisement.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, the live encoder can be signaled to start an advertisement.

trans-unit.source: The advertisement is inserted in the output stream.
trans-unit.target: The advertisement is inserted in the output stream.

trans-unit.source: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.
trans-unit.target: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.

trans-unit.source: Delete the Program (and optionally delete the asset).
trans-unit.target: Delete the Program (and optionally delete the asset).

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, the Azure Management Portal is used to accomplish the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, the Azure Management Portal is used to accomplish the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Configure streaming endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Configure streaming endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Create a channel that is enabled to perform live encoding.
trans-unit.target: Create a channel that is enabled to perform live encoding.

trans-unit.source: Get the Ingest URL in order to supply it to live encoder.
trans-unit.target: Get the Ingest URL in order to supply it to live encoder.

trans-unit.source: The live encoder will use this URL to ingest the stream into the Channel.
trans-unit.target: The live encoder will use this URL to ingest the stream into the Channel.

trans-unit.source: Create a program (and an asset)
trans-unit.target: Create a program (and an asset)

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset and get streaming URLs
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset and get streaming URLs

trans-unit.source: Play your content
trans-unit.target: Play your content

trans-unit.source: Cleaning up
trans-unit.target: Cleaning up

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: The following are required to complete the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: The following are required to complete the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](azure.microsoft.com).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](azure.microsoft.com).

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: To create a Media Services account, see [Create Account](media-services-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: To create a Media Services account, see [Create Account](media-services-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: A webcam and an encoder that can send a single bitrate live stream.
trans-unit.target: A webcam and an encoder that can send a single bitrate live stream.

trans-unit.source: Configure streaming endpoint using Portal
trans-unit.target: Configure streaming endpoint using Portal

trans-unit.source: When working with Azure Media Services, one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.
trans-unit.target: When working with Azure Media Services, one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.

trans-unit.source: With adaptive bitrate streaming, the client can switch to a higher or lower bitrate stream as the video is displayed based on the current network bandwidth, CPU utilization, and other factors.
trans-unit.target: With adaptive bitrate streaming, the client can switch to a higher or lower bitrate stream as the video is displayed based on the current network bandwidth, CPU utilization, and other factors.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).

trans-unit.source: When working with live streaming, an on-premises live encoder (in our case Wirecast) ingests a multi-bitrate live stream into your channel.
trans-unit.target: When working with live streaming, an on-premises live encoder (in our case Wirecast) ingests a multi-bitrate live stream into your channel.

trans-unit.source: When the stream is requested by a user, Media Services uses dynamic packaging to re-package the source stream into the requested adaptive bitrate stream (HLS, DASH, or Smooth).
trans-unit.target: When the stream is requested by a user, Media Services uses dynamic packaging to re-package the source stream into the requested adaptive bitrate stream (HLS, DASH, or Smooth).

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to get at least one streaming unit for the **streaming endpoint** from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to get at least one streaming unit for the **streaming endpoint** from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: To change the number of streaming reserved units, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To change the number of streaming reserved units, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Media Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Media Services**.

trans-unit.source: Then, click the name of the media service.
trans-unit.target: Then, click the name of the media service.

trans-unit.source: Select the STREAMING ENDPOINTS page.
trans-unit.target: Select the STREAMING ENDPOINTS page.

trans-unit.source: Then, click on the streaming endpoint that you want to modify.
trans-unit.target: Then, click on the streaming endpoint that you want to modify.

trans-unit.source: To specify the number of streaming units, select the SCALE tab and move the **reserved capacity** slider.
trans-unit.target: To specify the number of streaming units, select the SCALE tab and move the **reserved capacity** slider.

trans-unit.source: Scale page
trans-unit.target: Scale page

trans-unit.source: Press the SAVE button to save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Press the SAVE button to save your changes.

trans-unit.source: The allocation of any new units takes around 20 minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: The allocation of any new units takes around 20 minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: Create a CHANNEL
trans-unit.target: Create a CHANNEL

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click Media Services and then click on the Media Services account name.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click Media Services and then click on the Media Services account name.

trans-unit.source: Select the CHANNELS page.
trans-unit.target: Select the CHANNELS page.

trans-unit.source: Select Add+ to add a new channel.
trans-unit.target: Select Add+ to add a new channel.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Standard** encoding types.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Standard** encoding types.

trans-unit.source: This type specifies that you want to create a Channel that is enabled for live encoding.
trans-unit.target: This type specifies that you want to create a Channel that is enabled for live encoding.

trans-unit.source: That means the incoming single bitrate stream is sent to the Channel and encoded into a multi-bitrate stream using specified live encoder settings.
trans-unit.target: That means the incoming single bitrate stream is sent to the Channel and encoded into a multi-bitrate stream using specified live encoder settings.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).

trans-unit.source: standard0
trans-unit.target: standard0

trans-unit.source: For the **Standard** encoding type, valid ingest protocol options are:
trans-unit.target: For the **Standard** encoding type, valid ingest protocol options are:

trans-unit.source: Single bitrate Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming)
trans-unit.target: Single bitrate Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming)

trans-unit.source: Single bitrate RTMP
trans-unit.target: Single bitrate RTMP

trans-unit.source: RTP (MPEG-TS): MPEG-2 Transport Stream over RTP.
trans-unit.target: RTP (MPEG-TS): MPEG-2 Transport Stream over RTP.

trans-unit.source: For detailed explanation about each protocol, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed explanation about each protocol, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).

trans-unit.source: standard1
trans-unit.target: standard1

trans-unit.source: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.
trans-unit.target: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.

trans-unit.source: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.
trans-unit.target: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.

trans-unit.source: On the **Advertising Configuration** page you can specify the source for ad markers signals.
trans-unit.target: On the **Advertising Configuration** page you can specify the source for ad markers signals.

trans-unit.source: When using Portal, you can only select API, which indicates that the live encoder within the Channel should listen to an asynchronous Ad Marker API.
trans-unit.target: When using Portal, you can only select API, which indicates that the live encoder within the Channel should listen to an asynchronous Ad Marker API.

trans-unit.source: When using Portal, you can only select API.
trans-unit.target: When using Portal, you can only select API.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).

trans-unit.source: standard2
trans-unit.target: standard2

trans-unit.source: On the **Encoding Preset** page, you can select system presets.
trans-unit.target: On the **Encoding Preset** page, you can select system presets.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the only system preset you can select is **Default 720p**.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the only system preset you can select is **Default 720p**.

trans-unit.source: standard3
trans-unit.target: standard3

trans-unit.source: On the **Channel Creation** page, you can define the IP addresses that are allowed to publish video to this channel.
trans-unit.target: On the **Channel Creation** page, you can define the IP addresses that are allowed to publish video to this channel.

trans-unit.source: Allowed IP addresses can be specified as either a single IP address (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1’), an IP range using an IP address and a CIDR subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1/22’), or an IP range using an IP address and a dotted decimal subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1(255.255.252.0)’).
trans-unit.target: Allowed IP addresses can be specified as either a single IP address (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1’), an IP range using an IP address and a CIDR subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1/22’), or an IP range using an IP address and a dotted decimal subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1(255.255.252.0)’).

trans-unit.source: If no IP addresses are specified and there is no rule definition then no IP address will be allowed.
trans-unit.target: If no IP addresses are specified and there is no rule definition then no IP address will be allowed.

trans-unit.source: To allow any IP address, create a rule and set 0.0.0.0/0.
trans-unit.target: To allow any IP address, create a rule and set 0.0.0.0/0.

trans-unit.source: standard4
trans-unit.target: standard4

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Currently in Preview, the Channel start can take up to 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Currently in Preview, the Channel start can take up to 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Channel reset can take up to 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Channel reset can take up to 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Once you created the Channel, you can select the **ENCODER** tab where you can view your channels configurations.
trans-unit.target: Once you created the Channel, you can select the **ENCODER** tab where you can view your channels configurations.

trans-unit.source: You can also manage advertisements and slates.
trans-unit.target: You can also manage advertisements and slates.

trans-unit.source: standard5
trans-unit.target: standard5

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Working with Channels that Perform Live Encoding from a Single-bitrate to Multi-bitrate Stream](media-services-manage-live-encoder-enabled-channels.md).

trans-unit.source: Get ingest URLs
trans-unit.target: Get ingest URLs

trans-unit.source: Once the channel is created, you can get ingest URLs that you will provide to the live encoder.
trans-unit.target: Once the channel is created, you can get ingest URLs that you will provide to the live encoder.

trans-unit.source: The encoder uses these URLs to input a live stream.
trans-unit.target: The encoder uses these URLs to input a live stream.

trans-unit.source: readychannel
trans-unit.target: readychannel

trans-unit.source: ingesturls
trans-unit.target: ingesturls

trans-unit.source: Create and manage a program
trans-unit.target: Create and manage a program

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: A channel is associated with programs that enable you to control the publishing and storage of segments in a live stream.
trans-unit.target: A channel is associated with programs that enable you to control the publishing and storage of segments in a live stream.

trans-unit.source: Channels manage Programs.
trans-unit.target: Channels manage Programs.

trans-unit.source: The Channel and Program relationship is very similar to traditional media where a channel has a constant stream of content and a program is scoped to some timed event on that channel.
trans-unit.target: The Channel and Program relationship is very similar to traditional media where a channel has a constant stream of content and a program is scoped to some timed event on that channel.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the number of hours you want to retain the recorded content for the program by setting the **Archive Window** length.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the number of hours you want to retain the recorded content for the program by setting the **Archive Window** length.

trans-unit.source: This value can be set from a minimum of 5 minutes to a maximum of 25 hours.
trans-unit.target: This value can be set from a minimum of 5 minutes to a maximum of 25 hours.

trans-unit.source: Archive window length also dictates the maximum amount of time clients can seek back in time from the current live position.
trans-unit.target: Archive window length also dictates the maximum amount of time clients can seek back in time from the current live position.

trans-unit.source: Programs can run over the specified amount of time, but content that falls behind the window length is continuously discarded.
trans-unit.target: Programs can run over the specified amount of time, but content that falls behind the window length is continuously discarded.

trans-unit.source: This value of this property also determines how long the client manifests can grow.
trans-unit.target: This value of this property also determines how long the client manifests can grow.

trans-unit.source: Each program is associated with an Asset.
trans-unit.target: Each program is associated with an Asset.

trans-unit.source: To publish the program you must create an OnDemand locator for the associated asset.
trans-unit.target: To publish the program you must create an OnDemand locator for the associated asset.

trans-unit.source: Having this locator will enable you to build a streaming URL that you can provide to your clients.
trans-unit.target: Having this locator will enable you to build a streaming URL that you can provide to your clients.

trans-unit.source: A channel supports up to three concurrently running programs so you can create multiple archives of the same incoming stream.
trans-unit.target: A channel supports up to three concurrently running programs so you can create multiple archives of the same incoming stream.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to publish and archive different parts of an event as needed.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to publish and archive different parts of an event as needed.

trans-unit.source: For example, your business requirement is to archive 6 hours of a program, but to broadcast only last 10 minutes.
trans-unit.target: For example, your business requirement is to archive 6 hours of a program, but to broadcast only last 10 minutes.

trans-unit.source: To accomplish this, you need to create two concurrently running programs.
trans-unit.target: To accomplish this, you need to create two concurrently running programs.

trans-unit.source: One program is set to archive 6 hours of the event but the program is not published.
trans-unit.target: One program is set to archive 6 hours of the event but the program is not published.

trans-unit.source: The other program is set to archive for 10 minutes and this program is published.
trans-unit.target: The other program is set to archive for 10 minutes and this program is published.

trans-unit.source: You should not reuse existing programs for new events.
trans-unit.target: You should not reuse existing programs for new events.

trans-unit.source: Instead, create and start a new program for each event as described in the Programming Live Streaming Applications section.
trans-unit.target: Instead, create and start a new program for each event as described in the Programming Live Streaming Applications section.

trans-unit.source: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.
trans-unit.target: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.

trans-unit.source: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.
trans-unit.target: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.

trans-unit.source: To delete archived content, stop and delete the program and then delete the associated asset.
trans-unit.target: To delete archived content, stop and delete the program and then delete the associated asset.

trans-unit.source: An asset cannot be deleted if it is used by a program; the program must be deleted first.
trans-unit.target: An asset cannot be deleted if it is used by a program; the program must be deleted first.

trans-unit.source: Even after you stop and delete the program, the users would be able to stream your archived content as a video on demand, for as long as you do not delete the asset.
trans-unit.target: Even after you stop and delete the program, the users would be able to stream your archived content as a video on demand, for as long as you do not delete the asset.

trans-unit.source: If you do want to retain the archived content, but not have it available for streaming, delete the streaming locator.
trans-unit.target: If you do want to retain the archived content, but not have it available for streaming, delete the streaming locator.

trans-unit.source: Create/Start/Stop Programs
trans-unit.target: Create/Start/Stop Programs

trans-unit.source: Once you have the stream flowing into the Channel you can begin the streaming event by creating an Asset, Program, and Streaming Locator.
trans-unit.target: Once you have the stream flowing into the Channel you can begin the streaming event by creating an Asset, Program, and Streaming Locator.

trans-unit.source: This will archive the stream and make it available to viewers through the Streaming Endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This will archive the stream and make it available to viewers through the Streaming Endpoint.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to start event:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to start event:

trans-unit.source: From the **CHANNEL** page, press **ADD** to add a new program.
trans-unit.target: From the **CHANNEL** page, press **ADD** to add a new program.

trans-unit.source: Specify: program name, asset name, archive window, and encryption option.
trans-unit.target: Specify: program name, asset name, archive window, and encryption option.

trans-unit.source: createprogram
trans-unit.target: createprogram

trans-unit.source: If you left **Publish this program now** checked, the program the PUBLISHING URLs will get created.
trans-unit.target: If you left **Publish this program now** checked, the program the PUBLISHING URLs will get created.

trans-unit.source: You can press **START**, whenever you are ready streaming the program.
trans-unit.target: You can press **START**, whenever you are ready streaming the program.

trans-unit.source: Once you start the program, you can press PLAY to start playing the content.
trans-unit.target: Once you start the program, you can press PLAY to start playing the content.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use a shortcut and press **START STREAMING** button on the **CHANNEL** page.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use a shortcut and press **START STREAMING** button on the **CHANNEL** page.

trans-unit.source: This will create an Asset, Program, and Streaming Locator.
trans-unit.target: This will create an Asset, Program, and Streaming Locator.

trans-unit.source: The program is named DefaultProgram and the archive window is set to 1 hour.
trans-unit.target: The program is named DefaultProgram and the archive window is set to 1 hour.

trans-unit.source: You can play the published program from the CHANNEL page.
trans-unit.target: You can play the published program from the CHANNEL page.

trans-unit.source: channelpublish
trans-unit.target: channelpublish

trans-unit.source: If you click **STOP STREAMING** on the **CHANNEL** page, the default program will be stopped and deleted.
trans-unit.target: If you click **STOP STREAMING** on the **CHANNEL** page, the default program will be stopped and deleted.

trans-unit.source: The asset will still be there and you can publish or unpublish it from the **CONTENT** page.
trans-unit.target: The asset will still be there and you can publish or unpublish it from the **CONTENT** page.

trans-unit.source: If you switch to the **CONTENT** page, you will see the assets that were created for your programs.
trans-unit.target: If you switch to the **CONTENT** page, you will see the assets that were created for your programs.

trans-unit.source: contentasset
trans-unit.target: contentasset

trans-unit.source: Playing content
trans-unit.target: Playing content

trans-unit.source: To provide your user with a URL that can be used to stream your content, you first need to "publish" your asset (as was described in the previous section) by creating a locator (when you publish an asset using Portal, locators are created for you).
trans-unit.target: To provide your user with a URL that can be used to stream your content, you first need to "publish" your asset (as was described in the previous section) by creating a locator (when you publish an asset using Portal, locators are created for you).

trans-unit.source: Locators provide access to files contained in the asset.
trans-unit.target: Locators provide access to files contained in the asset.

trans-unit.source: Depending on what streaming protocol you want to use to playback your content, you might need to modify the URL that you get from the **PUBLISH URL** link of the channel\program.
trans-unit.target: Depending on what streaming protocol you want to use to playback your content, you might need to modify the URL that you get from the **PUBLISH URL** link of the channel\program.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic packaging will take care of packaging the live stream into the specified protocol.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic packaging will take care of packaging the live stream into the specified protocol.

trans-unit.source: By default, a streaming URL has the following format and you can use it to play Smooth Streaming assets:
trans-unit.target: By default, a streaming URL has the following format and you can use it to play Smooth Streaming assets:

trans-unit.source: To build an HLS streaming URL, append (format=m3u8-aapl) to the URL.
trans-unit.target: To build an HLS streaming URL, append (format=m3u8-aapl) to the URL.

trans-unit.source: To build an MPEG DASH streaming URL, append (format=mpd-time-csf) to the URL.
trans-unit.target: To build an MPEG DASH streaming URL, append (format=mpd-time-csf) to the URL.

trans-unit.source: For more information about delivering your content, see [Delivering content](media-services-deliver-content-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about delivering your content, see [Delivering content](media-services-deliver-content-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: You can playback Smooth Stream using [AMS Player](http://amsplayer.azurewebsites.net/azuremediaplayer.html) or use iOS and Android devices to play HLS version 3.
trans-unit.target: You can playback Smooth Stream using [AMS Player](http://amsplayer.azurewebsites.net/azuremediaplayer.html) or use iOS and Android devices to play HLS version 3.

trans-unit.source: Clean up
trans-unit.target: Clean up

trans-unit.source: If you are done streaming events and want to clean up the resources provisioned earlier, follow the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: If you are done streaming events and want to clean up the resources provisioned earlier, follow the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Stop pushing the stream from the encoder.
trans-unit.target: Stop pushing the stream from the encoder.

trans-unit.source: Stop the channel.
trans-unit.target: Stop the channel.

trans-unit.source: Once the Channel is stopped, it will not incur any charges.
trans-unit.target: Once the Channel is stopped, it will not incur any charges.

trans-unit.source: When you need to start it again, it will have the same ingest URL so you won't need to reconfigure your encoder.
trans-unit.target: When you need to start it again, it will have the same ingest URL so you won't need to reconfigure your encoder.

trans-unit.source: You can stop your Streaming Endpoint, unless you want to continue to provide the archive of your live event as an on-demand stream.
trans-unit.target: You can stop your Streaming Endpoint, unless you want to continue to provide the archive of your live event as an on-demand stream.

trans-unit.source: If the channel is in stopped state, it will not incur any charges.
trans-unit.target: If the channel is in stopped state, it will not incur any charges.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
